titleInfo.title: CHLORIDE CHANNEL-2 GENE (CLC2) MAPS TO CHROMOSOME-16 OF THE MOUSE, EXTENDING A REGION OF CONSERVED SYNTENY WITH HUMAN-CHROMOSOME-3Q

mods.abstract: The Clc2 gene of the mouse codes for the ubiquitously expressed chloride channel ClC-2, a member of a family of at least seven voltage gated chloride channels, some of which are implicated in hereditary diseases. Using a mouse interspecies back-cross panel, we have mapped Clc2 to Chr 16, proximal to the somatostatin gene Smst, extending a region of documented conserved synteny to human Chr 3q.

bibliographicCitation.apa: LENGELING, A., GRONEMEIER, M., RONSIEK, M., THIEMANN, A., JENTSCH, T. J., & Jockusch, H. (1995). CHLORIDE CHANNEL-2 GENE (CLC2) MAPS TO CHROMOSOME-16 OF THE MOUSE, EXTENDING A REGION OF CONSERVED SYNTENY WITH HUMAN-CHROMOSOME-3Q. GENETICAL RESEARCH, 66(02), 175-178.
